description:
Since the first time I saw Rho Ophiucus I fell in love with it... So, I took the change to work on it as soon as there were a couple of nights without rain or clouds.
This photo is 1x2 mosaic, which I intend to expand in the next few year. Unfortunately the integration time isn't much (about 3 hours for each panel) since this is really low on my horizon. Some clouds rolled in and I had to local normalize the photos, otherwise I'd had only 1.5 hours worth of data.
Building the mosaic was a real challenge, which was only overcome by using PI Photometric Mosaic script. The author, John Murphy (https://www.flickr.com/photos/johnastro-info/), was kind enough to help me in that task and I became a fan of it. It's not an easy script but results are well worth the effort to learn it (documentation available is excellent).
Anyway, I hope you enjoy this one as much as I enjoyed!
imaging_telescopes: William Optics RedCat 51 APO Apochromatic Quadruplet Refractor Astrograph Telescope - RED v1.5
title: Rho Ophiucus Mosaic - The Great Gig In The Sky
